**The Supreme Clarity Three Primordials Jade-Inscribed Three Primordials Scripture**

**Scripture Title:** *The Supreme Clarity Three Primordials Jade-Inscribed Three Primordials Scripture*. Author unknown, approximately composed during the Eastern Jin dynasty. A foundational scripture of the early Supreme Clarity tradition. One scroll. Base text from *Daoist Canon of the Zhengtong Era*, Dongxuan Section, Category of Original Texts.

---

**The Supreme Clarity Three Primordials Jade-Inscribed Three Primordials Scripture**

The *Highest Three Primordials Scripture* is a celestial writ of the Supreme Clarity Three Heavens, a jade-inscribed flying epistle of the Highest Perfected Ones, comprising the *Upper Primordial Jade-Inscribed Celestial Great Register*, the *Lower Primordial Jade-Inscribed Earthly Jade Texts*, and the *Middle Primordial Jade-Inscribed Perfected Immortals’ Writ*. These treasured scrolls, all inscribed with the writings of the Golden Elixir, are encased in a natural cloud-brocade pouch, sealed with the seals of the Three Primordials’ sacred spirits, and concealed within the Palace of Great Abundance in the Nine Heavens, the Nine-Bend Elixir Chamber of the Golden Terrace and Jade Hall. The Upper Primordial Lord of the Southern Culmen presides over them, attended by seven hundred Jade Maidens of the Upper Primordial Vermilion Palace, while three hundred Jade Lads of Numinous Emptiness hold towels and scatter incense under the guardianship of the Perfected Ones of the Heart of the Most High.

In the first year of the Qingxu era, the Celestial Venerable of Primordial Beginning descended to the Hall of Bright Mist and the Cloud Chamber of the Great Empyrean to teach, transmitting it to the Jade Lads of the Three Heavens, commanding them to govern the Three Ways and oversee all immortals. According to the statutes of the Highest Perfected Ones, only after seven thousand years of transmission may one who has attained Perfected Immortal status receive it. Without the engraving of the mysterious charts and records from before birth, none may rashly unfold these numinous writings. The Highest Ones employ the divine soldiers of the Five Thearchs to assist the Highest Perfected Ones in inspecting negligence, enforcing prohibitions with utmost severity.

The Most High Great Dao Lord received it from the Master of Primordial Antiquity, who transmitted it to the Perfected King of the Dark Capital. The Queen Mother of the West received it from the King of the Nine Heavens and transmitted it to the Great Thearch of Fusang. The Great Thearch transmitted it to the Later Sage Emperor of the Golden Gates, who in turn transmitted it to the Azure Lad of the Highest Minister. Today, one copy is preserved in the Eastern Florescence Palace, to be transmitted every seven thousand years in accordance with the statutes to those who attain Perfected Immortal status.

The Most High Dao Lord commanded the Five Elders and the Talismans of the Four Poles and Five Thearchs of the Perfected Capital to guard and protect the numinous writings, inspecting against leaks. Those who recklessly disclose its contents shall be punished with the Wind Blade; those who transmit it carelessly or neglect its teachings shall incur the burden of seven generations of ancestors and suffer personal retribution, enduring eternal servitude under the ghostly officials.

**The Three Primordials’ Writ states:**
The jade-inscribed texts emerged before the Nine Mysteries of the Empty Grotto, formed from the coagulation of natural qi into jade writings. The Nine Heavens divided and manifested them, the Three Ways unfolded their clarity, and the Three Primordials distributed their qi to inspect and govern the Three Perfected Ones. Without these texts, the Three Luminaries would dim, the Five Thearchs would misalign, the Nine Revolutions would overturn, and the Seven Celestial Bodies would scatter their essence. Without them, the earth would see the Nine Lands sink into abysses, the Five Peaks collapse, and mountains and rivers overturn. Without them, the learner would find no descent of immortal officials, no administration of earthly bureaus, no inscription of mysterious names in the Nine Heavens above—vain would be their studies, and the Dao would remain unattainable. Its methods are lofty and wondrous; the Three Primordials’ secret scrolls bestow upon those who obtain them the rank of Immortal Ministers.

The *Upper Primordial Jade-Inscribed Celestial Great Register* inspects the celestial great records, comprising the true writings of the Nine Heavens’ distributed qi and mysterious charts, as well as the titles and governance of the celestial perfected ones. Those who possess its texts may roam the Nine Heavens above, their lifespan equaling the kalpas. Those who behold its scrolls shall have their names inscribed in the Nine Heavens, their lives revolving through the palaces of rebirth, transforming into immortals. By diligently cultivating its practices for nine years, one may welcome the Sage Lord in the Palace of Supreme Clarity.

The *Lower Primordial Jade-Inscribed Earthly Jade Texts* inspect the numinous writings of the Nine Heavens’ distributed qi, governing the spirits of the Nine Earths. Those who obtain its texts may soar through the Great Void, where the Nine Yin shall not seize their souls; they may traverse the Five Peaks, tread the sources of rivers, and all spirits shall bow in reverence, myriad deities shall welcome them. Those who behold its scrolls shall ascend to the Nine Heavens, their lives revolving through transformations to become immortals. By cultivating its Dao for nine years, one may enter water without sinking, enter fire without burning, and with the descent of the Three Primordials, ascend to heaven in broad daylight.

The *Middle Primordial Jade-Inscribed Perfected Immortals’ Writ* comprises the hidden writings of the Nine Heavens and the decrees of immortal command. Those who possess its texts shall have immortal officials attend their courts and receive the descent of divine mushrooms and natural numinous medicines. By cultivating its Dao for nine years, celestial immortals shall descend in truth, earthly immortals shall manifest their numinosity, and flying immortals shall descend in their chariots, soaring through the void to ascend to the Jade Clarity. Those who behold its scrolls shall have their names inscribed in the Nine Heavens, their lives revolving through the palaces of rebirth, transforming into immortals.

**The Three Primordials’ Writ states:**
Without the jade-inscribed texts, the numinous officials of the Nine Lands shall not come to pay respects, the spirits governing mountains and seas shall not protect one’s form, and the celestial, earthly, and flying immortals of the Five Peaks shall not descend in cloud chariots, nor shall one’s mysterious name be recorded in the Nine Heavens above. Without reciting the jade chapters, heaven shall not descend its perfected ones, myriad demons shall invade one’s radiance, and those who seek flight shall instead sink. Those who wear the jade-inscribed texts shall see the Three Primordials revolve in unison, moving through emptiness and entering the void without hindrance, treading water and stepping through fire, soaring through the Nine Mysteries. Their bodies shall penetrate the Purple Void, their spirits shall reflect golden countenances, the seventy-two marks shall gleam brilliantly in the Great Void, and they shall govern the Three Heavens, presiding over all immortals. Thus, unless one has already attained Perfected Immortal status, none may transmit it lightly.

**The Upper Primordial Jade-Inscribed Celestial Great Register**

The *Supreme Clarity Jade Radiance Elixir Numinous Grotto-Heaven Upper Primordial Three Primordials Jade-Inscribed Text* is transmitted to the Perfected Ones of Supreme Clarity, who wear it to roam the myriad heavens, inspect and govern the Great Void, and command all perfected ones. Those who wear this text shall hold rank equal to the Numinous Immortals, receiving the reverence and protection of all heavens, the welcoming administration of the Five Thearchs. After nine years, they shall behold the Three Primordial Lords and be escorted to the Palace of Supreme Clarity.

To receive this text, one must fast for nine days, inscribe it with a green brush upon nine feet of yellow silk, and offer it in sacrifice at the mountain of one’s life destiny before wearing it. If after nine years one has not ascended, one must sacrifice again, casting the text into the azure mist of the empyrean, whereupon one shall receive a five-colored cloud chariot from the Jade Radiance Palace of Supreme Clarity to welcome the recipient’s body.

In the first year of the Qingxu era, the year *gengyin*, on the ninth day of the ninth month, the Celestial Venerable of Primordial Beginning, in the cyclical sign of *shangjia zhichen*, fasted in the Palace of Supreme Clarity and swore a covenant before the Unsurpassed, Unbounded, Colorless, Shadowless, Formless, Nameless, Ancestorless, Clanless, Limitless, Empty Clarity, and the Nine Mysteries of the Natural Kalpas Beyond Count. The Dao transmitted the *Three Primordials Jade-Inscribed Text* to the Jade Lads of the Three Heavens, commanding them to bestow it upon later learners whose mysterious names destined them to become Perfected Ones of Supreme Clarity. Their names were fixed upon the cinnabar terrace, in the golden repository of jade tablets, upon purple writings of jade slips. They were to welcome the Sage Lord, soaring to the Palace of Supreme Clarity, gazing upon the celestial titles of the natural bureaus of Supreme Clarity’s Empty Clarity, attending the Highest Perfected Ones, inspecting the heavens to summon immortals, restraining demons and commanding spirits, descending cloud chariots to welcome the body of so-and-so, all in accordance with the covenant writings of the Highest Perfected Ones of the Nine Heavens.

The *Upper Prime Heaven-Inspecting Great Register* is inscribed in blue-green ink upon nine-foot yellow silk and worn upon the body. The inscription must be taken to one’s life-destined Marchmount, where the Celestial Perfected are sacrificed to, the Nine Mysteries are invoked, and the Five Spirits are sworn to, before it is worn. If after nine years the Dao has not descended, two copies should be transcribed, and following the proper rites, one ascends the Marchmount to sacrifice anew to Heaven. Upon completion, one copy is burned, its ashes scattered into the azure mist of the skies, while the other is buried nine feet deep in one’s life-destined Marchmount. This is called: "Above, reporting to the Nine Heavens; below, reporting to the Five Marchmounts and numinous mountains; in the midst, reporting to the myriad spirits," thereby securing eternal life.

The *Lower Prime Earth-Inspecting Jade Register*
The *Three Primes Mysterious Terrace Jade Registers in Purple Script* are also called the *Nine Heavens Perfected Writ: Primordial Earth-Inspecting Register*, the *Three Primes Tiger Script*, and the *Flying Heavenly Perfected*. They are used to report to the essence of the Six Heavens and the myriad spirits, to regulate mountains and rivers, and to inspect the numina of the Nine Lands. Wearing this text commands the service of nine thousand Jade Maidens, and in the era of Great Peace, one may welcome the Sagely Lord at the Upper Clarity Palace. The recipient inscribes it in yellow ink upon blue-green silk and, after sacrificing at their life-destined Marchmount, wears it upon the body. If after nine years one has not ascended to Heaven, another copy should be transcribed and burned, its ashes scattered into the azure mist of the skies; yet another copy should be buried three feet deep in one’s life-destined Marchmount. Wearing this text, one may wander the Eight Directions, traverse the Five Marchmounts, and tread the sources of rivers; regulate the spirits of the earth, command the myriad spirits, and after nine years, ride the carriage of the Three Primes to ascend to the palace of the Three Primes. One must not rashly enter defiled or polluted places, nor offend the Celestial Perfected, nor lightly proclaim or reveal its secrets, lest one’s seven ancestors be held accountable, and one’s own body perish, losing the way to immortality.

The *Middle Prime Register of the Perfected Immortals*
The *Register of the Perfected Immortals* is also called the *Three Primes Chapter of the Great Perfected Yin-Yang Numinous Record*, a hidden script of the Three Heavens and Nine Spirits of the Upper Mystery. When Heaven and Earth reach the great reckoning of their kalpas—after eight thousand kalpas—this text appears once upon the Three Primes Mysterious Terrace, its true tally bestowed upon three hundred persons, with ninety-one Jade Maidens. Those who wear it find all the spirits of their form naturally ennobled as Jade Immortals. Without this text, the form and spirit cannot transform, and the sullied soul wanders aimlessly; aimless wandering leads the spirit to consort with evil, and consorting with evil brings the time of dissolution. Without the transformation of form and spirit, one cannot summon the immortal officials, command the Upper Perfected, or recite the Jade Chapters ten thousand times. The ten thousand recitations of the Jade Chapters contain the hidden names of the myriad spirits of the Nine Heavens’ Great Perfected; reciting them startles the Nine Heavens into heeding, and the myriad immortals into girding their sashes. Without the *Register of the Perfected Immortals*, to lightly command immortal officials and shake the Nine Heavens is to invite no descent of immortals, no celestial acceptance of one’s voice, the scattering of one’s hun-soul and po-soul, the flight of one’s spirit and the dispersal of one’s qi, the collapse of one’s palaces and the disturbance of one’s offspring, the birth of heavenly demons and calamities, and the dissolution of one’s body. Those who study this text find themselves spontaneously immortalized; when the era of Great Peace arrives, they may welcome the Sagely Lord at the Upper Clarity Palace. Without the *Mysterious Chart of the Imperial Writs* or the *Red Script of Inscribed Talismans*, one must not rashly proclaim the treasured texts, lest one’s seven ancestors be held accountable, one’s self be eternally confined to the offices of the dead, and one’s own life be forfeit, never again attaining immortality.

The *Profound and Supreme Perfected Three Primes Register of the Immortal Qi and Nine Spirits’ Hidden Script* is the text of the Western Sand Square Terrace. Bestowed by the Upper Prime of the Southern Culmen, it is the *Yellow Upper Perfected Assistant to the Heavenly Primordial Register of the Immortal Soul*. Those who wear this text ascend to fill the offices of immortals, and after a hundred days of meditating upon the spirits within their chambers, may behold the Lord of the Upper Prime, who will bestow upon them the true writ, enabling them to naturally fly to the Upper Clarity Palace. Without this text, one cannot practice the immortal way or summon the Perfected, and one’s body will suffer calamity.

The *Primordial Upper Birth of the Perfected Register of the Immortal Qi Three Primes Great Proclamation in Purple Script* is the hidden text of the Three Primes Terrace. Wearing it and entering one’s chamber to contemplate the Perfected for ninety days, one’s defiled qi will naturally dissipate, and one may behold the Great Lord of the Three Primes, who will bestow the true writ, enabling one to fly through the void after nine years. Without this text, one cannot practice the immortal way or summon the immortal officials, and one’s body will suffer calamity.

The *Highest Supreme Birth of the Perfected Writ: Register of the Immortal Qi and Purple Tenuity Mysterious Palace Flying Heavenly Perfected Script* appears in the chambers of the Five Marchmounts when the great kalpa of Heaven and Earth comes full cycle. Those who wear it and enter their chambers to contemplate the Three Primes for a hundred days, their essence and thought unwavering, may behold the true spirits descending to their form, enabling them to command immortal officials and obtain natural things. Beware the mire of life and death. Without this text, one cannot practice the immortal way, and to lightly summon the Celestial Perfected is to lose one’s body and fail to attain immortality.

The Perfected of the Various Heavens are forbidden to recite the *Nine Heavens’ Upper Writ*; those who do not bear this text shall be punished by the *Nine Heavens’ Piercing the Wicked*. Those who bear this text may have the *Nine Heavens’ Chancellor* summon and inspect the *Celestial Prime* to command the immortal officials. After a year of concentrated contemplation, they may behold the *Nine Heavens’ Perfected King*, who may appear as a single being with nine heads, riding a nine-colored phoenix and descending to their form. Upon seeing him, do not fear, for this *Nine Heavens’ Perfected King* presides over the registration of the highest Perfected. Simply prostrate facing south and petition for immortality, and you shall naturally receive the *Nine Heavens’ Writ*. This text must not be lightly recited alongside the *Thirty-Nine Chapters of the Great Cavern Perfected Scripture*; those who violate this shall have their nine generations consigned to torment, and their body shall be punished by the *Nine Heavens’ Piercing the Wicked*, their life extinguished within a hundred days.

The *Highest Mysterious Jade Register of the Three Primes* is inscribed within the Northern Chamber of the Numinous Capital, its celestial writ in jade characters, each a pace in length, accompanied by seven hundred *straight talismans* and eighty-two jade maidens. Those who bear this text and contemplate with focused essence for a hundred days shall have the Three Primes descend to their chamber, naturally attaining knowledge of the sounds of Heaven. Without this text, one must not recklessly practice the *Way of Flying Immortality*, lest their body suffer calamity, their seven generations be held accountable, and their immortal rank be lost.

The *Purple Tenuity Mysterious Palace Flying Heavenly Register* is inscribed upon the *Platform of Dawn’s Ascent*, illuminating the *Highest Clarity Upper Palace* above the Nine Heavens. The *Celestial Worthy of Primordial Beginning* transmitted it to the *Queen Mother of the West* to summon the immortal officials of the Five Marchmounts and the numinous immortals of mountains and seas. With a focused and tranquil mind, after a hundred days of contemplation, the spirits shall appear, and one shall naturally know their hidden name within the Nine Heavens. Those who bear it may summon immortal officials. Without this text, one must not recite the *Upper Scripture of Dispelling Demons*, lest their body suffer great calamity—beware, beware.

The *Mysterious Upper Flying Heavenly Middle Writ Register of Immortals* is inscribed upon the *Platform of the Three Primes*, issued by the *Venerable Lord of Myriad Beginnings* to transmit to the highest adepts for summoning immortals and attaining the Perfected. The recipient must sacrifice to the Five Marchmounts and contemplate with focused essence for a hundred days, whereupon a three-headed deity shall descend to their chamber. Without this text, one must not recklessly seek immortality on the eight seasonal days, lest their body suffer calamity. Those who bear it shall attain communion with the divine Perfected, granted twelve jade lads to transmit their recitations, which shall ascend to the Nine Heavens. Those who lightly divulge it shall have their seven generations consigned to servitude, and the *Five Marchmounts’ Talismanic Demon-Spirits* shall be commanded to torment their guilty souls.

The *Nine Heavens’ Dragon Writ of the Three Primes’ Empty Cavern Jade Register Flying Mysterious Text* is inscribed upon the gates of the *Three Passes of the Nine Heavens*, governing the prohibition of the Perfected of the Various Heavens. Those who recite the *Nine Heavens’ Upper Writ* without possessing this text shall be punished by the *Nine Heavens’ Piercing the Wicked*. Those who bear this text may have the *Nine Heavens’ Chancellor* summon and inspect the *Celestial Prime* to command the immortal officials. After a year of concentrated contemplation, they may behold the *Nine Heavens’ Perfected King*, who may appear as a single being with nine heads, riding a nine-colored phoenix and descending to their form. Upon seeing him, do not fear, for this *Nine Heavens’ Perfected King* presides over the registration of the highest Perfected. Simply prostrate facing south and petition for immortality, and you shall naturally receive the *Nine Heavens’ Writ*. Without this text, one must not lightly recite the *Thirty-Nine Chapters of the Great Cavern Perfected Scripture*; those who violate this shall have their nine generations consigned to torment, and their body shall be punished by the *Nine Heavens’ Piercing the Wicked*, their life extinguished within a hundred days.

The *Primordial Beginning Mysterious Empty Flying Heavenly Middle Writ Three Primes Jade Register* was inscribed by the *Celestial Worthy of Primordial Beginning* upon the *Golden Ramparts Platform*, transmitted once every ten thousand kalpas. Those who behold this text shall have their name inscribed in the *Eastern Florescence*. Those who bear it and contemplate with focused essence for three hundred days, their gaze unturned and their mind free of stray thoughts, shall behold the *Celestial Worthy of Primordial Beginning*. Upon seeing the *Celestial Worthy of Primordial Beginning*, they shall attain a lifespan of ten thousand years. The Jade Tallies of the Three Primes embody the Dao of the Eight Assemblies, the hidden scriptures of the Great Void, the secret mysteries of the Nine Heavens, and the wondrous chapters of the Supreme Clarity. They vanquish celestial demons through visualization and invocation, summoning jade immortals by their very nature. One who masters their methods will find every movement in harmony with the Perfected. His body shall generate water and fire, transforming in myriad ways. Through concentrated visualization, he ascends to the heights, and the Three Primes descend to take form.

To study without the Jade Scriptures is like a tree without roots—vainly exhausting one’s essence and sincerity, wearily depleting body and spirit. The celestial Perfected will not descend, and the body will not coalesce into immortality. To recite the precious scriptures lightly is to agitate the Nine Heavens, inviting the scrutiny of the inspectors of treachery, bringing calamity and annihilation upon oneself.

Thus, Heaven has its protocols of reverence, and the scriptures possess their hierarchical ranks. They mutually regulate one another, with higher and lower in harmonious accord. Only when the qi is fully replete does one accord with spontaneity. The Three Primes serve as the sovereigns who govern all others, while the Five Thearchs act as the officials who enforce punishments. Those who lightly undertake study without possessing the complete celestial scriptures shall be restrained. Those who leak and divulge them shall be punished by the Wind Blade, facing the consequences of life and death.

Cultivate with utmost care, following the path of the highest realms, and immortality will come easily. Yet one must guard against carelessly transgressing the celestial scriptures, violating prohibitions, and incurring punishments. Such consequences arise from shallow understanding and narrow learning, failing to fathom the origins of the Dao. To vainly invoke the Perfected with an empty body—how could the Perfected descend? With the Dao failing to descend, celestial demons seize the opportunity.

Thus, the student should widely seek instruction, exploring the famous mountains. Tread through ten thousand trials without retreat, endure nine hardships with exceptional diligence, and only then may one gain access to the celestial scriptures and be deemed worthy to receive the precious texts as a True Person of the Four Poles. Only then shall one’s qi be complete, and immortality achieved.

Yet to encounter a single scroll and sit passively, hoping for the celestial Perfected to descend with a single word, is like a fish in the abyss longing to soar to the edge of the Nine Heavens. Such study—is it not futile?

The precious, secret Jade Tallies of the Upper Prime of the Southern Culmen may not be seen in their entirety by those lacking golden bones, jade marrow, or whose names are not inscribed in the imperial registers of the Thearchs. Even if they are carelessly divulged and obtained by the vulgar and unworthy, within a hundred days, they will inevitably be punished by celestial calamities, and the scriptures will vanish of their own accord.

If one encounters a numinous master, ascends the sacred peaks to pledge alliance and receive transmission, yet fails to adhere to the prescribed time limits and recklessly shows the texts to others, the punishment shall extend to the roots of his nine generations of ancestors, and his own person shall bear the Wind Blade’s retribution.

If, within a hundred years, a true student of the highest learning who wears and cultivates the supreme scriptures has not yet seen these texts, he may transmit them to two others. First, he must ascend the numinous Marchmount to pledge alliance with the Nine Heavens, and only then may he be permitted to show them the Jade Scriptures. He must not lightly divulge the supreme Perfected texts without first making his oath. Should he do so, he shall be struck down by the divine soldiers of the Five Thearchs, his nine generations of ancestors seized and cast into hell, his own body annihilated by the Three Offices, his three disciples condemned to bear the weight of stones, and the Five Sufferings inflicted upon him atop the Mountain of Knives.

If one disregards the consequences of fortune and misfortune, there is no need to trouble oneself with the pursuit of immortality.

the Primordial lingers in contemplation.

Only those whose sincerity moves the depths shall be met by the officials of illusory reflection, who open the fordways of their passage—this is the means to perfect attainment.

With these incantations, practiced within a hundred days, no demon shall remain, and no true spirit shall fail to descend.

I humbly beseech the descent of the celestial perfected, that I may soar through the Upper Clarity, attend the Lower Primordial, and swiftly attain divine transcendence.

Petitioned on the [Day] of the [Month] in the [Year], at the hour of [Time].

Inscribe this in white ink upon a silver tablet, one foot and two inches in length. Bury it on the northern slope of a mountain, three feet deep.

The Three Primordial Jade Tablets are the most sacred writ of the celestial perfected. They form the foundation of transcendence practice. Perform this rite for a hundred days, and the divine forms shall manifest. No prayer shall go unanswered, no thought unfulfilled, no aspiration unaccomplished. Those who obtain this method shall ascend to heaven in broad daylight.

If silver is unavailable, use jade; if jade is unavailable, silverwood may suffice. Ensure the tablet is wrapped in pure white cloth, free of any impurity, before use.

Long ago, Ning Xuanfu received this method from the August Supreme Perfected. Nine years after his ascension failed, he buried the tablets on White Hollow Mountain, nine feet deep. Later, the disciple Li Zhongjun passed by the chamber of White Hollow Mountain. After a hundred days of fasting and devotion, he suddenly beheld a silver tablet inscribed with jade script within the cavern. Zhongjun offered a pledge of gold and azure, vowing sincerity before the spirits. After three years of kneeling devotion, the Three Primordials descended, extending his lifespan by seven hundred years. He then journeyed to Lao Valley Master, received the true writ, and ascended to heaven.

A copy of this writ remains sealed on White Hollow Mountain.

The Primordial Sovereign, in the celestial wilds of Golden Mound, bestowed this upon the Azure Void Perfected, Master Wang, to teach those whose bone destiny aligns with transcendence. Those who obtain this method shall attain transcendence without study.

**The Upper Method for Internal Cultivation of the Three Primordials: Summoning the Perfected and Inviting the Divine**

The Three Primordial Sovereigns of Grand Simplicity dwell in the Highest Upper Clarity Palace, within the Hall of Vast Spirit. The morning lamps illuminate the Jade Perfected; radiant light shines within the Cinnabar Chamber. The Three Flowers exhale their brilliance in spontaneity; divine splendor illumines the Nine Mysteries. Auspicious spirits gather upon the Jade Terrace; flying mists thicken at the Purple Pavilion. The Mysterious Chart is revealed in the Upper Gallery; the Five Talismans are ordered within the Embryonic Venerable. The Three Primordials are arrayed in Grand Simplicity; the Register of Life is governed at the Jade Gate. In lofty solitude, they contemplate the wondrous abyss. When they emerge to wander the Empyrean Observatory, the sun and moon incline their radiance; the ranked candles uproot their foundations. The Eight Winds reverse their waves; the tempest stirs the hidden source. Jade brilliance gleams in clarity; the high heavens dance at dawn. Crimson clouds unfold in layers; yellow mists coil sevenfold. The Five Elders open the path; the Supreme Emperor supports the wheel. The Western Sovereign bears the staff; the Eastern Flower raises the banner. The Nine Heavens waver in reverence; the Grand Primordial stirs the mist. Hidden qi gathers in obscurity; the Eight Effulgences brush away dust. Gazing upward, they survey the boundless; looking down, they encompass the hundred spheres. Truly, they are the most exalted of the perfected, their wondrous transformations beyond measure.

The Three Primordial Lords of Grand Simplicity are the maiden of singular perfection, mothers of the Three Primordial Ladies of Simplicity. The Primordial Lady of Grand Simplicity coalesced in an empty womb, born of blossoming radiance, delivered in the Highest Upper Clarity’s Jeweled Simplicity of the Nine Mysteries Jade Sovereign Heaven. Her taboo-name is Zheng Hui Tiao, her style Yun Chun Ying. Upon her head she wears the Jeweled Langfu Dawn Feather Crown; her robe is a floating-cloud brocade of purple qi, her skirt a nine-hued dragon-silk feathered garment. At her waist hangs a belt of flowing gold, fire bells, tiger talismans, and dragon-script. She sits amid the Great Void, beneath her knees ever the cinnabar, green, and azure clouds of the Three Simplicities, their qi crowning and veiling her form.

For those who would practice the Dao of flying transcendents and bear the script of the Three Primordials’ Jade Tallies, at midnight within a secluded chamber, face north, close the eyes, and knock the teeth thrice. Visualize the Three Primordial Lords of Grand Simplicity in their raiment, taboo-names, and styles, riding the cinnabar, green, and azure Simplicity whirlwind-chariot, descending from the Jade Sovereign Heaven into the chamber. Then, with the heart, bow to the Primordial Lady and softly invoke:

Triune qi, primordial essence,
Nine Heavens’ supreme numen,
dawn’s radiance gleams in clarity,
jade blossoms illumine the cave.
Three Simplicities’ flying whirlwind,
cinnabar shafts and green chariots,
Eight Winds raise the wheels,
flowing reflections brighten the Empyrean court.
Summon the perfected, induce transcendence,
descend into my form.
May all aspirations prosper,
every intent achieve fulfillment.
Golden countenance, blossoming visage,
inner treasury resplendent.
Eight Effulgences bear the palanquin,
bones take flight, flesh grows light.
Ascend the cinnabar terrace,
pay homage in Jade Clarity.

Conclude, then swallow qi twenty-four times and cease. Open the eyes and recite the Jade Clarity Upper Palace’s *Lonesome Chant of Jeweled Jade*, harmonizing with the qi of form and soul, rejoicing in the Grand Simplicity’s exalted perfected. The chant:

Grand Primordial links Jade Clarity,
Three Luminaries illumine the heights.
Eight Effulgences turn the dawn wind,
scattering clouds, misty flying numina.
Round wheels cast into the empty vast,
golden reflections crown Heaven’s essence.
Jade blossoms bind the Five Elders,
purple mists wheel the Empyrean chariot.
Riding qi, sway the mysterious chamber,
yield and follow, transcend the traversed.
Golden visage gleams with ninefold auroras,
jade form radiates the frigid court.
Secluded youths turn childlike glances,
aged elders revert to infancy.
The Celestial One solidifies the mud-pill,
Nine Perfected guard Yellow Tranquility.
Gaze beyond ten thousand kalpas,
equal this Nine Heavens’ inclination.

Conclude, then with the heart bow, swallow saliva thrice, and cease entirely.

The eldest daughter of the Primordial Lady of Grand Simplicity is the Primordial Lady of Purple Simplicity, mother of the Lord of Non-Flourishing. The Primordial Lady of Purple Simplicity reposed in a jade womb within a purple embryo, nurturing emptiness’s elegance in the Jade Portal, coalescing numinous progeny to embody perfection, congealing spirit to emerge in spontaneity. Her taboo-name is Yi Yu Qi Ren, her style An Lai Shang. Upon her head she wears the Supreme Perfection Dawn Infant Crown, a three-cornered topknot, the rest of her hair unbound and trailing to her waist. Above, she dons a purple brocade robe; below, a frost-flying gauze skirt. She also wears the sash of numinous flight, seated upon the Great Void, ever veiled by purple-qi clouds crowning her form.

For those who would practice the second Dao of flying transcendents and bear the script of the Three Primordials’ Jade Tallies, at midnight within a secluded chamber, face north, close the eyes, and knock the teeth thrice. Visualize the Primordial Lady of Purple Simplicity in her raiment, taboo-name, and style, riding the purple-cloud Three Simplicities’ flying chariot, descending from Upper Clarity into the left chamber of your numinous dwelling. Then, with the heart, bow to the Primordial Lady of Purple Simplicity and softly invoke:

Triune Primordials’ exalted numina,
Purple Simplicity’s cloud chariot,
strategize the void, tread emptiness,
wander the Empyrean court.
Flowing perfected descend in gaze,
gallop the canopy’s blossoming essence.
Three Passes securely settled,
cave chamber illumined in clarity.
Bones transform, flesh ascends,
inner and outer take flight in lightness.
Eastern Blossom inscribes the tally,
August Elders record the name.
Three Perfected descend and bestow,
my Dao attains long life.
Ascend to enjoy primordial felicity,
nothing fails to achieve fruition.
Attain to ride the flying effulgence,
ascend to Jade Clarity.

Conclude, then swallow qi twenty-four times, open the eyes, and recite the Jade Clarity Upper Palace’s *Lonesome Chant of Jeweled Jade*. Its words:

Mysterious emptiness penetrates primordial simplicity,
Three Cinnabars govern the luminous mechanism.
Flying Empyrean luxuriates in Purple Clarity,
brilliant cascades open the Nine Heavens’ gates.
I ride the numinous movement,
suddenly revering the Three Gates’ opening.
Hands grasp the Heaven-Earth portal,
feet tread the Five Peaks’ ladder.
Gazing within the myriad regions,
occasionally answering my heart’s intent.
Awakening to see the origin beyond movement,
thus the exalted perfected return.
Together incline the Heaven-Earth kalpa,
soaring the void in flight.

Conclude, then with the heart bow, swallow saliva thrice, and cease entirely.

The Primordial Lady of Yellow Simplicity is the middle daughter of Grand Simplicity, mother of the Central Yellow Elder Lord. The Primordial Lady of Yellow Simplicity’s taboo-name is Que Hui Yuan Hua Huang Ren, her style Tai Zhang Shang. Upon her head she wears the Supreme Perfection Dawn Infant Crown, a three-cornered topknot, the rest of her hair unbound and trailing to her waist. Above, she dons a yellow brocade robe; below, a five-hued flying azure brocade skirt. She wears the sash of phoenix-script numinous blossoms, at her waist a belt with a flowing-yellow radiance-dispelling sword, seated upon the Mysterious Void, ever veiled by yellow-cloud qi crowning her form.

For those who would practice the Dao of flying transcendents and bear the script of the Three Primordials’ Jade Tallies, at midnight within a secluded chamber, face north, close the eyes, and knock the teeth thrice. Visualize the Primordial Lady of Yellow Simplicity in her raiment, taboo-name, and style, riding the Three Simplicities’ flying chariot, descending from Upper Clarity into the central chamber of your numinous dwelling. Then, with the heart, bow to the Primordial Lady of Yellow Simplicity and softly invoke:

Triune qi’s exalted perfected,
supreme numinous primordial spirit,
flowing effulgences in the Empyrean chamber,
entering and exiting the blossoming dawn.
Returning perfected descend,
illuminating my spirit in clarity.
Penetrate the mysterious, pierce the subtle,
summon the numinous, induce transcendence.
Inspect and govern the four movements,
reverse the kalpa, halt the years.
Revert the aged to blossoming visage,
golden countenance within as transcendent.
Serve the Three Primordials,
ascend the purple chariot.

Conclude, then swallow qi twenty-four times, open the eyes, and recite the Jade Clarity Upper Palace’s *Lonesome Chant of Jeweled Jade*. Its words:

Flying Empyrean mists the mysterious peak,
cloud nets weave the Heavenly web.

The pure Han’s numinous resonance flows,
exquisite chant harmonizes with the rhythm.
Since I have wearied of mundane utility,
what pursuit could be deemed excessive?
Only then do I awaken to the Three Mysteries’ revelation,
the Nine Cycles suddenly slipping past.
Gazing within the great image,
unaware of what may come.
Lacking the art of the fasting youths,
misty qi descends as jade radiance.
Without harnessing spring’s power,
how can one preserve the yang branch?

Conclude, then bow in the heart, swallow saliva thrice, and cease.

The Primordial Lady of White Simplicity is the youngest daughter of the Primordial Lady of Supreme Simplicity and the mother of the White Primordial Lord. Her taboo name is *Qiming Xiaoren*, her style *Jinmen Shang*, her head crowned with the *Grand Perfected Dawn Infant’s* coronet, her triple-coiled chignon unbound, the rest of her hair cascading to her waist. She wears an upper garment of luminous white brocade and a lower skirt of flying-frost green brocade, girded with a pendant of *Six-Mountain Fire Jade* and a sash of *Phoenix-Writ Phoenix-Floret*, her waist bearing the *Sun-Extending Radiance* sword. She sits upon the *Mystic Void*, ever enveloped in a mist of white cloud that veils her form.

To practice the Dao of flying transcendence and bear the script of the *Three Primordials’ Jade Tallies*, one must at midnight within a secluded chamber face north, close the eyes, and knock the teeth thrice. Visualize the Primordial Lady of White Simplicity—her raiment, taboo name, and style—riding a white, simple flying wheel, descending from the Highest Clarity into the right chamber of one’s *Cavern Palace*. Then bow in the heart to the Primordial Lady of White Simplicity and softly invoke:

Primal numinous void,
mysterious image reveals the true.
Three unite as one,
ascending to transform spontaneously.
Heavenly blossoms stream their gaze,
descending spirits mold the elixir.
Curved reflections return the numinous,
illuminating my body in radiance.
Penetrate the Three Passes,
qi spreads through the cinnabar field.
Transform yin and yang,
unite with the imperial spirit’s honor.
Soul settled, spirit tranquil,
eternally preserve the jade transcendent.
Ascend the golden terrace’s effulgence,
pay homage to the Three Primordials.
Uttermost numinous heaven and earth,
rejoice in exultant bliss.

Conclude, then swallow qi twenty-four times and cease. Open the eyes and recite once more the Jade Clarity Upper Palace’s *Lonesome Chant of Jeweled Jade*. Its words:

Whirlwind wheels dance the hollow void,
chanting songs at the cloud’s edge.
Lonesome, bright, lofty resonance,
scattering winds harmonize with jade pipes.
A hundred strains arise in the remote realm,
flying mists gallop the six reins.
Vast and unbound, shedding myriad burdens,
pure lapels free of the slightest hindrance.
Unfettered, roam the nine wilds,
transcend the eight spheres’ bounds.
Carefree between heaven and earth,
how could one reckon years or age?

Conclude, then bow in the heart and swallow saliva thrice to cease.

The Jade Clarity Upper Palace’s *Lonesome Chant of Jeweled Jade* comprises ninety chapters. The Three Primordial Lords preside over it, and the Primordial Lords ever chant its verses to harmonize the qi of form and soul, to rejoice the perfected of the Nine Palaces. Practicing the Dao of the Three Primordials, one should recite this chant to seek resonance with the utmost numinous and summon the path of the descending mystic elixir. Cultivating this Dao for no more than three years, visualizing the Three Primordials, one will perceive their semblance, and they shall descend in your form. Upon beholding the Three Primordials, one attains longevity of ten thousand years.

The Highest regards the Three Primordials as the root of the cavern, the Great Elixir as the Three Primordials’ utmost essence. The Three Primordials, containing the true and flourishing effulgence, arise from the void, dwelling in the Highest Highest Clarity’s *Jeweled Simplicity Nine Mysteries Jade Emperor Heaven*, congealing spirit in the Great Vastness, tranquil in the numinous pass. Above, they govern ten thousand offices, universally leading the host of transcendents; they inspect and hold the precious scriptures, overseeing the cavern texts. At the center, they govern the registers, the names of those who attain the Dao, the ledgers of life and death, all subject to their charge. Below, they regulate the Five Peaks, the mountains and seas, the rivers and springs; above, they govern the Highest, below, the Cavern Palace.

For the practitioner, one should chant the exquisite verses in a silent chamber, scatter jade tones through the nine voids. Then the seven ancestors receive grace from the Highest, dark souls are reborn as womb transcendents, the primordial father transforms in the numinous capital, the mystic mother rejoices in the jade chamber. Accumulated resonance stirs in the essence of feeling, secret contemplation pierces the Great Void, the divine countenance is unveiled in wondrous vision, the numinous descends spontaneously. Within three years, one may attain audience with the Primordial of Supreme Simplicity and behold the true forms of the Three Primordials.

The Primordial Lords of Supreme Simplicity and the Three Primordials of Simplicity conceal their names and styles, all appellations of the empty void’s spontaneity, forming tones from the purple void’s resonance. Knowing the name of the Primordial Lady of White Simplicity and visualizing her for three years, one may behold her true form; seeing her true form, one attains longevity of three thousand years. Knowing the name of the Primordial Lady of Yellow Simplicity and visualizing her for three years, one may behold her true form; seeing her true form, one attains longevity of ten thousand years. Knowing the name of the Primordial Lady of Purple Simplicity and visualizing her for three years, one may behold her true form; upon beholding her, one attains wealth and longevity of thirty thousand years. Knowing the Primordial Lords of Supreme Simplicity, one’s longevity endures as long as heaven and earth; visualizing them, one beholds their true forms. Upon beholding the Primordial Lords of Supreme Unity, one’s longevity rivals heaven and earth.

The precious names and utmost taboos are secrets of the Highest. Those who know them inscribe their names in the mystic records, and twelve jade maidens of the Upper Palace of the Three Primordials attend and guard their persons. To lightly disclose or disseminate them invites the seven ancestors to bear the blame, one’s own life forfeit, subject to the three calamities, five sufferings, and ten thousand kalpas of irredeemable torment.

**The Hidden Audience of the Three Primordials: Inner Dao of the Upper Transcendents**

All who receive the *Three Primordials’ Jade Tallies* and cultivate the Dao of the Three Primordials must at dawn within a secluded chamber pay homage to the Primordial Lords of Supreme Simplicity. Regularly on the tenth day of the first month, the ninth day of the second month, the eighth day of the third month, the seventh day of the fourth month, the sixth day of the fifth month, the fifth day of the sixth month, the fourth day of the seventh month, the third day of the eighth month, the second day of the ninth month, the eleventh day of the tenth month, the twelfth day of the eleventh month, and the thirteenth day of the twelfth month, at midnight in a tranquil chamber, burn incense, face north, and bow in the heart thrice. Then, seated or reclining as one wishes, kowtow and invoke in the heart:

With reverence, I invoke the Supreme Great Dao, the High Void Jade Dawn, the Three Primordial Lords of the Supreme Simplicity Purple Palace, the Central Yellow Elder, the Peerless, the White Primordial, the Jade Emperor, the Five Elders of the Highest Perfected, the Jade Lord of the Mysterious Imperial Ultimate. I, so-and-so, am a disciple of the Three Effulgences of the Great Cavern. On this auspicious night, when the celestial passes open ninefold, I humbly announce before the Supreme Primordial Lords of Supreme Simplicity, the Three Primordial Ladies of Simplicity, and the True Lord Jade Emperor, beseeching longevity in the world, an age of a hundred million years, to ride the yellow dawn’s green-canopied dragon carriage, ascend to the Purple Court, command the myriad spirits, and attend the Four Luminants and the Primordial Lord of Supreme Simplicity.

Having completed this, bow thrice in reverence and swallow nine times while gazing upward. This practice should be performed regularly, without others knowing. Such is the Way of the Hidden Audience with the Three Primordials by the Perfected of the Supreme Ultimate—offering nocturnal rites and vows.

The *Three Primordials’ Jade Tallies of the Supreme Clarity* and the *Three Primordials’ Dispersed Scriptures* conclude here. #1 *Ascended Immortal*: likely a scribal error for *Celestial Immortal*.

chunks.original_text: 上清三元玉检三元布经 经名：上清三元玉检三元布经。 撰人不详，约出於东晋。 系早期上清派重要经典。 一卷。 底本出处：《正统道藏》洞玄部本文类。 上清三元玉检三元布经 高上三元布经，乃上清三天真书，上真玉检飞空之篇，上元检天大录、下元检地玉文、中元检仙真书。 如是宝篇，高上皆刻金丹书，设以自然云锦之囊，封以三元宝神之章，藏於九天之上大有之宫，金台玉室九曲丹房。 南极上元君主之，以上元朱宫玉女七百人，侍卫神真心太上又以灵虚玉童三百人，执巾散香。 至清虚元年，元始天王於明霞之馆太霄云房下教，以授三天玉童，使部统三道，总检万仙。 依太真之科，七千年听传已成真人，自非刻书玄图，记录於未生，不得妄披灵文。 高上以五帝神兵辅於上真，检於漏慢，其禁尤严。 太上大道君受之於玄古先生，以传玄都仙王，西王母受之於九天王，以传扶桑大帝君，大帝君以传后圣金阙帝君，金阙帝君以传上相青童君。 今藏一通於东华宫，依科七千年当传以成真人。 太上道君命五老仙都符四极五帝，辅卫灵文，检於漏泄。 有妄说篇目，罚以风刀，轻传慢替，七祖充责，己身负考，长役鬼官。 三元篇曰：玉检之文，出於九玄空洞之先，结自然之气以成玉文，九天分判，三道演明，三元布气，检御三真。 天无此文，则三光昏翳，五帝错位，九运翻度，七宿奔精。 地无此文，则九土沦渊，五岳崩溃，山河倒倾。 学无此文，则仙官不降，地官不营，九天之上不书玄名，徒劳为学，道无由成。 其法高妙，三元秘篇，有得其文，位加仙卿。 上元玉检检天大录，皆九天布炁玄图真文，九天官号部御天真。 得备其文，则得遨游九天之上，寿同劫年。 得见其篇，则九天书名，轮转生宫，化而更仙。 恒能修行九年，得奉迎圣君於上清宫。 下元玉检检地玉文，皆九天布气玄文，检九地之灵。 得其文，则能飞行太空，九阴不敢拘兆之魂，游行五岳，履涉河源，群灵稽首，万神奉迎。 得见其篇，则化上九天，转轮更生，九变成仙。 能修其道九年，则入水不陷，入火不然，三元下降，白日升天。 中元玉检检仙真书，皆九天隐文，命仙之章。 得备其文，则仙官侍庭，降致神芝自然灵药。 修行其道九年，天仙降真，地仙降灵，飞仙降轿，乘空飞行，上升玉清。 得见其篇，九天书名，轮转生宫，化而更仙。 三元篇曰：学无玉检之文，九地灵官不来敬迎，山海司灵不卫身形，天仙、地仙、五岳飞仙不降云軿，九天之上不领玄名。 不诵咏玉章，天不降真，万魔侵景，求飞反沈。 身佩玉检，三元齐轮，出空入虚，变化无间，履水蹈火，翱翔九玄，身洞紫虚，神映金颜，七十二相，朗耀太空，主司三天，位总群仙。 故非已成真人，不得轻传。 上元检天大录 上清玉景丹灵洞天上元三元玉检文，以授上清真人，佩游诸天，检御太空，摄领群真。 得佩此文，位同灵仙，诸天敬护，五帝司迎，九年得见三元君，奉诣上清宫。 受此文，斋九日，青笔书九尺黄缯上，祭之於本命之岳，然后佩身。 九年未升者，当又祭，投书於青烟之霄，则得上清玉景宫给以五色云车，奉迎受者身。 清虚元年岁在庚寅九月九日，上甲直辰元始天王，清斋上清宫，告盟无上无巅、无色无景、无形无名、无祖无宗、无极洞清九玄自然无数劫，道授三元玉检文於三天玉童，使付后学有玄名，应为上清真人者，定名於丹台金藏玉策，紫文琼札，奉迎圣君飞行上清宫，俯仰上清洞清自然官号，侍卫上真，检天招仙，制魔役灵，降致云车，奉迎某甲身，皆如太真九天盟文。

**The Supreme Clarity Three Primordials Jade-Inscribed Three Primordials Scripture**

**Scripture Title:** *The Supreme Clarity Three Primordials Jade-Inscribed Three Primordials Scripture*. Author unknown, approximately composed during the Eastern Jin dynasty. A foundational scripture of the early Supreme Clarity tradition. One scroll. Base text from *Daoist Canon of the Zhengtong Era*, Dongxuan Section, Category of Original Texts.

---

**The Supreme Clarity Three Primordials Jade-Inscribed Three Primordials Scripture**

The *Highest Three Primordials Scripture* is a celestial writ of the Supreme Clarity Three Heavens, a jade-inscribed flying epistle of the Highest Perfected Ones, comprising the *Upper Primordial Jade-Inscribed Celestial Great Register*, the *Lower Primordial Jade-Inscribed Earthly Jade Texts*, and the *Middle Primordial Jade-Inscribed Perfected Immortals’ Writ*. These treasured scrolls, all inscribed with the writings of the Golden Elixir, are encased in a natural cloud-brocade pouch, sealed with the seals of the Three Primordials’ sacred spirits, and concealed within the Palace of Great Abundance in the Nine Heavens, the Nine-Bend Elixir Chamber of the Golden Terrace and Jade Hall. The Upper Primordial Lord of the Southern Culmen presides over them, attended by seven hundred Jade Maidens of the Upper Primordial Vermilion Palace, while three hundred Jade Lads of Numinous Emptiness hold towels and scatter incense under the guardianship of the Perfected Ones of the Heart of the Most High.

In the first year of the Qingxu era, the Celestial Venerable of Primordial Beginning descended to the Hall of Bright Mist and the Cloud Chamber of the Great Empyrean to teach, transmitting it to the Jade Lads of the Three Heavens, commanding them to govern the Three Ways and oversee all immortals. According to the statutes of the Highest Perfected Ones, only after seven thousand years of transmission may one who has attained Perfected Immortal status receive it. Without the engraving of the mysterious charts and records from before birth, none may rashly unfold these numinous writings. The Highest Ones employ the divine soldiers of the Five Thearchs to assist the Highest Perfected Ones in inspecting negligence, enforcing prohibitions with utmost severity.

The Most High Great Dao Lord received it from the Master of Primordial Antiquity, who transmitted it to the Perfected King of the Dark Capital. The Queen Mother of the West received it from the King of the Nine Heavens and transmitted it to the Great Thearch of Fusang. The Great Thearch transmitted it to the Later Sage Emperor of the Golden Gates, who in turn transmitted it to the Azure Lad of the Highest Minister. Today, one copy is preserved in the Eastern Florescence Palace, to be transmitted every seven thousand years in accordance with the statutes to those who attain Perfected Immortal status.

The Most High Dao Lord commanded the Five Elders and the Talismans of the Four Poles and Five Thearchs of the Perfected Capital to guard and protect the numinous writings, inspecting against leaks. Those who recklessly disclose its contents shall be punished with the Wind Blade; those who transmit it carelessly or neglect its teachings shall incur the burden of seven generations of ancestors and suffer personal retribution, enduring eternal servitude under the ghostly officials.

**The Three Primordials’ Writ states:**
The jade-inscribed texts emerged before the Nine Mysteries of the Empty Grotto, formed from the coagulation of natural qi into jade writings. The Nine Heavens divided and manifested them, the Three Ways unfolded their clarity, and the Three Primordials distributed their qi to inspect and govern the Three Perfected Ones. Without these texts, the Three Luminaries would dim, the Five Thearchs would misalign, the Nine Revolutions would overturn, and the Seven Celestial Bodies would scatter their essence. Without them, the earth would see the Nine Lands sink into abysses, the Five Peaks collapse, and mountains and rivers overturn. Without them, the learner would find no descent of immortal officials, no administration of earthly bureaus, no inscription of mysterious names in the Nine Heavens above—vain would be their studies, and the Dao would remain unattainable. Its methods are lofty and wondrous; the Three Primordials’ secret scrolls bestow upon those who obtain them the rank of Immortal Ministers.

The *Upper Primordial Jade-Inscribed Celestial Great Register* inspects the celestial great records, comprising the true writings of the Nine Heavens’ distributed qi and mysterious charts, as well as the titles and governance of the celestial perfected ones. Those who possess its texts may roam the Nine Heavens above, their lifespan equaling the kalpas. Those who behold its scrolls shall have their names inscribed in the Nine Heavens, their lives revolving through the palaces of rebirth, transforming into immortals. By diligently cultivating its practices for nine years, one may welcome the Sage Lord in the Palace of Supreme Clarity.

The *Lower Primordial Jade-Inscribed Earthly Jade Texts* inspect the numinous writings of the Nine Heavens’ distributed qi, governing the spirits of the Nine Earths. Those who obtain its texts may soar through the Great Void, where the Nine Yin shall not seize their souls; they may traverse the Five Peaks, tread the sources of rivers, and all spirits shall bow in reverence, myriad deities shall welcome them. Those who behold its scrolls shall ascend to the Nine Heavens, their lives revolving through transformations to become immortals. By cultivating its Dao for nine years, one may enter water without sinking, enter fire without burning, and with the descent of the Three Primordials, ascend to heaven in broad daylight.

The *Middle Primordial Jade-Inscribed Perfected Immortals’ Writ* comprises the hidden writings of the Nine Heavens and the decrees of immortal command. Those who possess its texts shall have immortal officials attend their courts and receive the descent of divine mushrooms and natural numinous medicines. By cultivating its Dao for nine years, celestial immortals shall descend in truth, earthly immortals shall manifest their numinosity, and flying immortals shall descend in their chariots, soaring through the void to ascend to the Jade Clarity. Those who behold its scrolls shall have their names inscribed in the Nine Heavens, their lives revolving through the palaces of rebirth, transforming into immortals.

**The Three Primordials’ Writ states:**
Without the jade-inscribed texts, the numinous officials of the Nine Lands shall not come to pay respects, the spirits governing mountains and seas shall not protect one’s form, and the celestial, earthly, and flying immortals of the Five Peaks shall not descend in cloud chariots, nor shall one’s mysterious name be recorded in the Nine Heavens above. Without reciting the jade chapters, heaven shall not descend its perfected ones, myriad demons shall invade one’s radiance, and those who seek flight shall instead sink. Those who wear the jade-inscribed texts shall see the Three Primordials revolve in unison, moving through emptiness and entering the void without hindrance, treading water and stepping through fire, soaring through the Nine Mysteries. Their bodies shall penetrate the Purple Void, their spirits shall reflect golden countenances, the seventy-two marks shall gleam brilliantly in the Great Void, and they shall govern the Three Heavens, presiding over all immortals. Thus, unless one has already attained Perfected Immortal status, none may transmit it lightly.

---

**The Upper Primordial Jade-Inscribed Celestial Great Register**

The *Supreme Clarity Jade Radiance Elixir Numinous Grotto-Heaven Upper Primordial Three Primordials Jade-Inscribed Text* is transmitted to the Perfected Ones of Supreme Clarity, who wear it to roam the myriad heavens, inspect and govern the Great Void, and command all perfected ones. Those who wear this text shall hold rank equal to the Numinous Immortals, receiving the reverence and protection of all heavens, the welcoming administration of the Five Thearchs. After nine years, they shall behold the Three Primordial Lords and be escorted to the Palace of Supreme Clarity.

To receive this text, one must fast for nine days, inscribe it with a green brush upon nine feet of yellow silk, and offer it in sacrifice at the mountain of one’s life destiny before wearing it. If after nine years one has not ascended, one must sacrifice again, casting the text into the azure mist of the empyrean, whereupon one shall receive a five-colored cloud chariot from the Jade Radiance Palace of Supreme Clarity to welcome the recipient’s body.

In the first year of the Qingxu era, the year *gengyin*, on the ninth day of the ninth month, the Celestial Venerable of Primordial Beginning, in the cyclical sign of *shangjia zhichen*, fasted in the Palace of Supreme Clarity and swore a covenant before the Unsurpassed, Unbounded, Colorless, Shadowless, Formless, Nameless, Ancestorless, Clanless, Limitless, Empty Clarity, and the Nine Mysteries of the Natural Kalpas Beyond Count. The Dao transmitted the *Three Primordials Jade-Inscribed Text* to the Jade Lads of the Three Heavens, commanding them to bestow it upon later learners whose mysterious names destined them to become Perfected Ones of Supreme Clarity. Their names were fixed upon the cinnabar terrace, in the golden repository of jade tablets, upon purple writings of jade slips. They were to welcome the Sage Lord, soaring to the Palace of Supreme Clarity, gazing upon the celestial titles of the natural bureaus of Supreme Clarity’s Empty Clarity, attending the Highest Perfected Ones, inspecting the heavens to summon immortals, restraining demons and commanding spirits, descending cloud chariots to welcome the body of so-and-so, all in accordance with the covenant writings of the Highest Perfected Ones of the Nine Heavens.

chunks.original_text: 主禁诸天真人诵九天上书，不得佩此文者，罚之九天刺奸也。 得佩此文，九天丞相主召检天元制仙官，精思一年，得见九天真王，或见一人九头，乘九色之凤，降兆形也。 见之勿恐，此九天真王主录上真也。 但南向伏地，启乞求仙，自当得授九天之书也。 此文，不得轻诵三十九章大洞真经也。 犯之九祖充考，身为九天刺奸所罚，不出百日必灭命也。 高上玄微玉检三元文，刻书灵都北房之中，天书玉字，字方一丈，直符七百人，玉女八十二人。 佩其文，百日精思，三元降房，子自然知天中之音。 无此文，不得妄行飞仙之道，身则被殃，七祖充责，失仙之品也。 紫微玄宫飞天检文，刻书晨登之台，照明九天之上太清上宫，元始天王授西王母，招召五岳山海灵仙之官。 精心静念，百日见神，自知九天中隐名。 佩者致仙官。 无此文，不得诵消魔上经，身被大殃，慎之慎之。 玄上飞天中书检仙之文，刻三元之台，万始先生所出，以传高上人，召仙致真。 受者祭五岳，百日精思，见一躯三头之神，降兆之房。 无此文，不得八节日妄行求仙之事，身被殃也。 佩之神真通达，给玉童十二人，传说所诵，上闻九天也。 轻泄七祖充贵，勑五岳符魔灵考，对罪魂也。 右九天龙书三元空洞玉检飞玄文，刻题九天三关之门，主禁诸天真人。 诵九天上书，不得备此文者，罚之九天刺奸也。 得佩此文，九天丞相主召检天元，制仙官。 精思一年，得见九天真王，或见一人九头，乘九色之凤，降兆形也。 见之勿恐，此九天真王主录上真也。 但南向伏地，启乞求仙，自当得授九天之书也。 无此文，不得轻诵三十九章大洞真经，犯之九祖充考，身为九天刺奸所罚，不出百日必灭命也。 元始玄空飞天中书三元玉检文，元始天王刻书金墉之台，经万劫一传。 得见此文，四极即书名於东华。 佩之精思三百日，目不他视，心不异想，即见元始天王。 见元始天王，便寿万年。 学无此文，不得入名山，游五岳，行飞仙之道。 五岳不受，人天魔伐身，必被大殃也。 太真金书九天上空洞隐文，九天父母书之凤生台，直符八百人，九千年九天一开，九天开则九日俱明於东方，此文则自明於得道之人，南轩之上也。 若有玄名帝录，四真亦降授於兆身。 得有此文，九百日精思定神，克见九天父母也。 得见九天父母，无复死没之期。 无此文，轻行万遍之道，招召仙真，身必被殃，七祖充役，不复又仙。 维年月日，某岳真人某甲，从先生某甲告盟受文，今登玄坛，告天启授，某岳先生某甲，关五帝五岳三官九府上真四司，奉文之禁，如太真科不泄之盟。 佩游诸天诸地诸水名山，无亿数自然天官，莫不敬迎，灭魔降仙，飞行太空，奉迎圣君於上清宫。 九天当投文九天某甲，轻慢天文，妄泄告人，某甲七祖长责鬼官，身受风刀之考，死负九原之役，不敢蒙仙。 书文皆以黄缯为地，青笔书之，以朱笔规四面，以宝密天真也。 受者对斋七十日，或二十七日，或七日。 弟子赉上金五两，凤文之罗九十尺，绿文之缯三十二尺，诣师共登本命之岳，受三元之文，当北向安座，以香蔬饼果设之盛盘，清油九升设以九灯，罗列一座，以绯罗五尺设文，别安按上，置中央，又以一按请信物，置东面。

chunks.original_text: 弟子西向伏，师向北叩齿三十六通，祝曰： 今日上告，天真散灵，八景徘徊，九帝临庭，三元解带，上关三清，是日弥昌，万愿利贞，谨登玄岳，告盟五灵，馌果招真，以表至情，四司五帝，玄监我形，天真来降，我道洞明，携契同盟，飞登上清。 毕，仰咽三十六气，心拜五方，还北向，长跪上告： 九天太空太虚玄灵高上元始道君、上清玉皇众圣大仙灵官监真真仙四司帝君，臣昔从先师中岳先生张君，奉三元玉检秘固灵篇，不敢轻宣，九五促度，灵运推迁，圣君临正，上选皇臣，以补上真。 今有某岳先生某甲，夷心静默，仙学寻真，积涉未降，今心期高上，启誓告灵，禀受宝篇，仰希神仙即日启度，如太真之盟，天仙下降，监映某甲身，修行上彻，俾得道真，飞行玄虚，升入三清。 轻泄告人，宣露天文，某甲以生死父母、七祖种根，长闭地狱，万劫不原，身没鬼官，不敢又仙。 毕，师读文竟，起长立，左手执文，弟子长跪，右手受文，二人同以余手指天西北角，弟子仰祝曰： 上告九虚，下誓五灵，禀受天文，敢违盟言，轻泄放露，疑贰天真，生死父母，九祖种根，及身长没，同负河源，三途五苦，万劫敢怨。 毕，便去。 三元玉检八会之道，太空之隐文，九天之秘奥，上清之奇篇，灭天魔於存祝，招玉仙於自然。 学得其法，举动合真，身生水火，变化万端，存思上彻，三元降形。 学无玉文，如树无根，徒劳精诚，疲顿身神，天真不降，体不结仙。 轻诵宝经，骇动九天，刺奸所考，殃灭兆身。 故上天有俯仰之仪，经有品次之格，更相制御，上下相倾，气气备足，乃应自然。 三元为总他之主，五帝为纠罚之官，禁於轻学，不全天文，纠於漏泄，罚於风刀，生死之对。 慎而修行、如高上之道，易为神仙，而患为学越略天文，触罪犯禁，便收考殃。 皆由见浅学狭，不极道原，空体招真，真何由降焉。 道既不降，天魔乘空。 故学宜广访，寻诸名山，履万试而不退，经九难而殊勤，然后始可得闯於天文、克当为四极真人玄授於宝文，备炁成仙也。 但遇一卷而坐听，希天真於一言，将譬渊下之鳞，望飞九霄之端，如此之学，岂不劳乎。 南极上元宝秘玉检之文，自无金骨玉髓，玄名帝图，不得见其篇第。 纵复漏泄，为凡猥所得，不过百日，必为天灾所罚，经自灭也。 若运遇灵师，登盟启授，而不依年限，妄以示人，考及九祖种根，身负风刀之罚。 若百年之中，有上学真人佩修至经，未见是文，听传二人。 当先登灵岳，告盟九天，然后听得示以玉文。 不得无所告誓，而轻泄至真，伐以五帝神兵，摄九祖於地狱，灭已身於三官，责三徒於负石，加五苦於刀山。 若不顾於祸福，亦无烦於求仙也。 青童君曰：凡九天上书，太真科文，禁罚皆同一等，至於三元偏宝玉检之文。 然玉检文九天官号，检制仙气，万根所宗，何得不秘乎。 后学诸君，皆有志尚希慕上仙，而能录宝其文，使清真遗苦诚之言，又不遵承，将非自其命乎。 佩玉检文，入室思三元君，始思之时，未即得见三元君者，或有异光及他形之神，仿髴眼前，此无怪也，皆是天真试子故也。 若闭眼见有青紫二色之光，微微来降，此则常肠青真玉虚之气，太素元君虚映之官号也。

The disciple prostrates facing west, while the master faces north and strikes his teeth thirty-six times, then intones the prayer:

"Today, I humbly announce to the celestial Perfected, the scattered numina of the Dao, the Eight Luminaries who wander in cycles, the Nine Thearchs who descend to this court. The Three Primes loosen their sashes, ascending to commune with the Three Clarities. May this day be ever prosperous, and ten thousand vows bring forth upright fortune. Solemnly I ascend the numinous Marchmount to pledge alliance with the Five Spirits. With offerings of fruits and vegetables, I summon the Perfected to witness my utmost sincerity. May the Four Controllers and Five Thearchs, the numinous overseers of my form, cause the celestial Perfected to descend, that my Dao may become resplendently clear. Together we shall forge a covenant, soaring to ascend the Supreme Clarity."

This done, he swallows thirty-six breaths with head raised, prostrates to the five directions, then returns to face north. Kneeling upright, he makes his declaration:

"To the Nine Heavens’ Great Void, the Mysterious Numen of the Lofty Supreme, the Primordial Dao Lord of the Highest Clarity, the Jade Thearch of the Supreme Clarity, the host of sagely immortals, the numinous officials who oversee the Perfected, the Perfected Immortals, and the Four Controllers and Thearchs: Your servant once followed his former master, Master Zhang of the Central Marchmount, in receiving the Jade Tallies of the Three Primes and the secret, sealed scriptures of the numinous chapters. I dared not lightly disclose them. Now, as the Nine and Five hasten the deliverance of beings, and the numinous destiny shifts with the times, the Sagely Lord assumes his rightful place, selecting from among the imperial ministers to replenish the ranks of the Supreme Perfected.

Today, this Marchmount Master, so-and-so, has cultivated a heart of equanimity and stillness, seeking the Dao and pursuing the Perfected. Though his accumulated practice has not yet borne fruit, his aspirations now soar to the highest realms. He pledges his oath and invokes the numina, humbly receiving this precious scripture. May the divine immortals, on this very day, initiate his deliverance, as in the covenant of the Supreme Perfected. May the celestial immortals descend to oversee and illuminate his person, that his cultivation may ascend to the heights, enabling him to attain the Perfected Dao, soar through the Mysterious Void, and ascend into the Three Clarities.

Should he lightly divulge these teachings to others or reveal the celestial patterns, then by his parents who gave him life and the roots of his seven generations of ancestors, may he be eternally confined to the earthly prisons, never to be pardoned through ten thousand kalpas. May his body perish among the ghostly officials, and may he never again become an immortal."

This concluded, the master finishes reading the text, rises to stand upright, and holds the scripture in his left hand. The disciple kneels upright, receiving the text with his right hand. Together, with their remaining hands, they point to the northwest corner of the sky. The disciple raises his head and intones:

"I solemnly announce to the Nine Voids above and pledge my oath to the Five Spirits below. Having received the celestial scripture, should I dare to violate this covenantal vow, lightly divulging or carelessly revealing it, or harboring doubts toward the celestial Perfected, then by my parents who gave me life, the roots of my nine generations of ancestors, and my own person, may we all perish together, bearing the weight of the River’s source. May we endure the Three Paths and Five Sufferings, and through ten thousand kalpas, dare not complain."

This done, they depart.

The Jade Tallies of the Three Primes embody the Dao of the Eight Assemblies, the hidden scriptures of the Great Void, the secret mysteries of the Nine Heavens, and the wondrous chapters of the Supreme Clarity. They vanquish celestial demons through visualization and invocation, summoning jade immortals by their very nature. One who masters their methods will find every movement in harmony with the Perfected. His body shall generate water and fire, transforming in myriad ways. Through concentrated visualization, he ascends to the heights, and the Three Primes descend to take form.

To study without the Jade Scriptures is like a tree without roots—vainly exhausting one’s essence and sincerity, wearily depleting body and spirit. The celestial Perfected will not descend, and the body will not coalesce into immortality. To recite the precious scriptures lightly is to agitate the Nine Heavens, inviting the scrutiny of the inspectors of treachery, bringing calamity and annihilation upon oneself.

Thus, Heaven has its protocols of reverence, and the scriptures possess their hierarchical ranks. They mutually regulate one another, with higher and lower in harmonious accord. Only when the qi is fully replete does one accord with spontaneity. The Three Primes serve as the sovereigns who govern all others, while the Five Thearchs act as the officials who enforce punishments. Those who lightly undertake study without possessing the complete celestial scriptures shall be restrained. Those who leak and divulge them shall be punished by the Wind Blade, facing the consequences of life and death.

Cultivate with utmost care, following the path of the highest realms, and immortality will come easily. Yet one must guard against carelessly transgressing the celestial scriptures, violating prohibitions, and incurring punishments. Such consequences arise from shallow understanding and narrow learning, failing to fathom the origins of the Dao. To vainly invoke the Perfected with an empty body—how could the Perfected descend? With the Dao failing to descend, celestial demons seize the opportunity.

Thus, the student should widely seek instruction, exploring the famous mountains. Tread through ten thousand trials without retreat, endure nine hardships with exceptional diligence, and only then may one gain access to the celestial scriptures and be deemed worthy to receive the precious texts as a True Person of the Four Poles. Only then shall one’s qi be complete, and immortality achieved.

Yet to encounter a single scroll and sit passively, hoping for the celestial Perfected to descend with a single word, is like a fish in the abyss longing to soar to the edge of the Nine Heavens. Such study—is it not futile?

The precious, secret Jade Tallies of the Upper Prime of the Southern Culmen may not be seen in their entirety by those lacking golden bones, jade marrow, or whose names are not inscribed in the imperial registers of the Thearchs. Even if they are carelessly divulged and obtained by the vulgar and unworthy, within a hundred days, they will inevitably be punished by celestial calamities, and the scriptures will vanish of their own accord.

If one encounters a numinous master, ascends the sacred peaks to pledge alliance and receive transmission, yet fails to adhere to the prescribed time limits and recklessly shows the texts to others, the punishment shall extend to the roots of his nine generations of ancestors, and his own person shall bear the Wind Blade’s retribution.

If, within a hundred years, a true student of the highest learning who wears and cultivates the supreme scriptures has not yet seen these texts, he may transmit them to two others. First, he must ascend the numinous Marchmount to pledge alliance with the Nine Heavens, and only then may he be permitted to show them the Jade Scriptures. He must not lightly divulge the supreme Perfected texts without first making his oath. Should he do so, he shall be struck down by the divine soldiers of the Five Thearchs, his nine generations of ancestors seized and cast into hell, his own body annihilated by the Three Offices, his three disciples condemned to bear the weight of stones, and the Five Sufferings inflicted upon him atop the Mountain of Knives.

If one disregards the consequences of fortune and misfortune, there is no need to trouble oneself with the pursuit of immortality.

The Green Lad Lord said: "All the celestial writings of the Nine Heavens and the disciplinary texts of the Supreme Perfected share the same prohibitions and punishments, especially the Jade Tallies of the Three Primes, which are particularly precious.

Yet the Jade Tallies contain the titles of the Nine Heavenly Offices, regulating the qi of immortals and serving as the origin of ten thousand roots. How could they not be kept secret?

Later students, all of whom aspire to emulate the highest immortals, should treasure these texts, heeding the earnest words left by the pure and true. To fail in this is to forsake one’s own destiny.

When wearing the Jade Tallies and entering the chamber to visualize the Lords of the Three Primes, one may not immediately perceive them at the outset. Perhaps a strange light or other divine forms may appear before one’s eyes—this is no cause for alarm, for it is merely the celestial Perfected testing the student.

If, with eyes closed, one sees lights of blue and purple gently descending, these are the subtle emanations of the Azure Perfected of the Jade Void and the celestial titles of the Void-Reflecting Palace of the Primordial Lady of the Grand Simplicity."

chunks.original_text: 兆当引气八十一咽，祝曰： 天真降，道气明，谒三元，朝玉清，登玄台，观神形，受秘号，羽服生，万仙来迎，飞行帝庭。 毕，如此三百日，克得见太素元君真形也。 若见赤玄二光勃勃来降，此‘则少阳上真清虚之气，紫素元君虚映之官号也。 兆当引气六十四咽，祝曰： 飞天降，回玉真，入紫清，朝上仙，侍三元，招万神，睹其形，受宝言，我道备，升九天。 毕，如此三百日，则见紫素元君真形也。 若见黄白二色之光郁郁来降，此则中黄玄真太虚之气，黄素元君虚映之官号也。 兆当引气三十六咽，祝曰： 中天徘徊，三气相随，玄母混合，散灵紫微，黄白分判，我道来归，丹琼绿舆，运我升飞，上诣朱房，三元同晖。 毕，行此三百日，克见黄素元君真形也。 若见乱色之光，光无定色，勃勃来降，此则玄阴洞虚之气，白素元君虚映之官号也。 兆当引气二十四咽，祝曰： 三气变化，五色流黄，素晖散真，混合中元，来降我室，我道明分，仰眄 神容，如兰如云，使我道备，上升玉门，朝谒真形，三元之君。 毕，行此三百日，克见白素元君真形也。 若见九色之凤，或一凤九头，此则九天玄母虚映之官，来降兆身，兆道欲成也。 慎勿言，叩齿九通，咽气九过，祝曰： 天降地载，二气交真，三五混合，共成我身，六气同庆，万愿开陈，上享无极，至道来臻，得乘龙凤，驾御紫烟，飞行上清，玉虚同邻。 毕，心拜九过止。 如此九百日中，精思不倦，克见玄母真形，得观真人，寿无极年。 若见光色明如日月之象，此则九天元父虚映之官，下降兆身，道欲成也。 慎勿言，叩齿十二通，咽气十二过，祝曰： 玄气散真，变化无方，天交地合，虚映太空，迥灵下降，与元混同，八景携契，九帝结朋，得观上真，朝礼朱房，长保天地，亿劫不穷。 毕，心拜九过止。 行之九百日，精思不替，克见元父於兆房也。 若见一人九头，或着九色斑衣，此则九天真王主录上真虚映之官也，下降兆身，道欲成也。 慎勿言，叩齿九通咽气三过止。 祝曰： 九天上灵，元皇之精，三合九变，炼化胎婴，回真混沌，虚降我形，掇我死根，延我长生，得同天地，永享亿龄。 毕，心拜九过止。 行之七百日内，克见九天真王对面共言，能飞行九天之上也。 若见龙头凤身之人，或一乌九头，此则元始天王左治虚映上真之官，下降兆身，道欲成也。 慎勿言，叩齿九通，咽气三十二过，密祝曰： 三道顺行，元始徘徊，玄真映朗，九灵散开，流眄无穷，降我光辉，上披朱景，解滞豁怀，得御飞霞，腾身紫微。 毕，心拜三过止。 行之三百日，克见元始真形，授兆九天上书，飞行玉清也。 若见一躯三头之神，或一人执五色之旛者，此则五岳仙伯校真主录之官，来察子所修也。 见之但正心存思，勿失正也。 叩齿三通，密祝曰： 玄玄黑黑，五帝之神，正气来降，为我致仙，我仙由真，非真莫前，我修玉文，检御诸天，上告元始，普下名山，咸令万灵，来卫我轩，使我飞行，上升帝晨。 毕，引气五咽止。 行此百日，仙伯降形，克诣兆房，八节之日登山，则五岳奏兆名於东华之宫，九年自然成仙也。 若见老公，头建黄巾，衣黄衣，腰或带绶，手或持刀，或持九节杖者，此则天中大魔，或是灵山之王，来试子也。

The adept should draw in qi with eighty-one swallows and intone the prayer:

*"Celestial Perfected descend,
Dao’s qi shines bright.
I pay homage to the Three Primes,
attend the Jade Clarity,
ascend the Mystic Terrace,
behold the divine forms,
receive the secret names,
and sprout feathered robes.
The ten thousand immortals come to welcome me,
soaring to the imperial court."*

Upon completion, after three hundred days of such practice, one will succeed in beholding the true form of the Primordial Lady of the Grand Simplicity.

If one sees crimson and dark lights surging forth and descending, these are the subtle emanations of the Lesser Yang Supreme Perfected of the Pure Void and the celestial titles of the Void-Reflecting Palace of the Purple Simplicity Primordial Lady. The adept should draw in qi with sixty-four swallows and intone the prayer:

*"Flying immortals descend,
revolving Jade Perfected,
enter the Purple Clarity,
attend the Supreme Immortals,
serve the Three Primes,
summon the ten thousand spirits,
gaze upon their forms,
receive the precious words.
My Dao is complete—
I ascend the Nine Heavens."*

Upon completion, after three hundred days of such practice, one will behold the true form of the Purple Simplicity Primordial Lady.

If one sees lights of yellow and white hues, rich and descending, these are the subtle emanations of the Central Yellow Mysterious Perfected of the Grand Void and the celestial titles of the Void-Reflecting Palace of the Yellow Simplicity Primordial Lady. The adept should draw in qi with thirty-six swallows and intone the prayer:

*"Wandering the Central Heavens,
the Three Qi follow in train.
The Mystic Mother blends all,
dispersing numinous radiance in the Purple Tenuity.
Yellow and white divide and judge,
my Dao returns to me.
Cinnabar jade and green chariots
convey me in ascent,
upward to the Vermilion Chamber,
where the Three Primes shine as one."*

Upon completion, after three hundred days of such practice, one will succeed in beholding the true form of the Yellow Simplicity Primordial Lady.

If one sees lights of shifting colors, their hues unfixed, surging forth and descending, these are the subtle emanations of the Mysterious Yin Cavernous Void and the celestial titles of the Void-Reflecting Palace of the White Simplicity Primordial Lady. The adept should draw in qi with twenty-four swallows and intone the prayer:

*"The Three Qi transform,
the Five Colors flow as yellow.
Pristine radiance scatters the true,
blending in the Central Prime.
Descend into my chamber,
my Dao is made manifest.
I gaze upward at the divine countenance,
like orchids, like clouds.
My Dao is complete—
I ascend the Jade Gate,
pay homage to the true forms,
the Lords of the Three Primes."*

Upon completion, after three hundred days of such practice, one will succeed in beholding the true form of the White Simplicity Primordial Lady.

If one sees a nine-colored phoenix, or a single phoenix with nine heads, this is the celestial title of the Void-Reflecting Palace of the Mystic Mother of the Nine Heavens, descending upon the adept’s body—one’s Dao is nearing completion. Take care not to speak. Knock the teeth nine times, swallow qi nine times, and intone the prayer:

*"Heaven bears, Earth sustains,
the Two Qi merge in truth.
The Three and Five blend as one,
together forming my body.
The Six Qi rejoice in unison,
the ten thousand wishes unfold.
I offer to the Boundless,
the Supreme Dao draws near.
I ride the dragon and phoenix,
mount the purple mist,
soaring to the Upper Clarity,
dwelling beside the Jade Void."*

Upon completion, bow nine times in the heart and cease. After nine hundred days of such practice, with unwavering focus, one will succeed in beholding the true form of the Mystic Mother and witnessing the Perfected Ones, attaining limitless years of life.

If one sees lights as bright as the sun and moon, this is the celestial title of the Void-Reflecting Palace of the Primordial Father of the Nine Heavens, descending upon the adept’s body—one’s Dao is nearing completion. Take care not to speak. Knock the teeth twelve times, swallow qi twelve times, and intone the prayer:

*"Mysterious qi scatters the true,
transforming without bound.
Heaven joins with Earth,
the Void reflects the Great Emptiness.
The numinous descends from afar,
merging with the Primordial.
The Eight Effulgences unite in harmony,
the Nine Emperors form fellowship.
I behold the Supreme Perfected,
pay homage in the Vermilion Chamber,
eternally preserving Heaven and Earth,
enduring through kalpas without end."*

Upon completion, bow nine times in the heart and cease. After nine hundred days of such practice, with unrelenting focus, one will succeed in beholding the Primordial Father in one’s chamber.

If one sees a being with one body and nine heads, or clad in nine-colored patterned robes, this is the celestial title of the Void-Reflecting Palace of the Nine Heavens True King, Keeper of the Registers of the Supreme Perfected, descending upon the adept’s body—one’s Dao is nearing completion. Take care not to speak. Knock the teeth nine times and swallow qi three times, then intone the prayer:

*"Spirit of the Nine Heavens,
essence of the Primordial Sovereign,
threefold union, ninefold transformation,
refining and transmuting the embryo.
Returning to the true, merging with the primordial,
the Void descends into my form.
Pluck out the roots of death,
prolong my life without end.
I become one with Heaven and Earth,
eternally enjoying boundless years."*

Upon completion, bow nine times in the heart and cease. Within seven hundred days of such practice, one will succeed in beholding the Nine Heavens True King face-to-face and converse with him, able to soar above the Nine Heavens.

bestowing immortality upon me.

governing the myriad heavens.

universally to the named mountains,
commanding the ten thousand spirits
